title: Pow(x, n)
description:
Pow(x, n)

Implement pow(x, n), which calculates x raised to the power n (i.e., xn).

Examples:

  • Input: x = 2.00000, n = 10
    Output: 1024.00000
  • Input: x = 2.10000, n = 3
    Output: 9.26100
  • Input: x = 2.00000, n = -2
    Output: 0.25000

Constraints:

  • -100.0 < x < 100.0
  • -231 <= n <= 231 - 1
  • n is an integer
  • Either x is not zero or n > 0
solution_text:
Pow(x, n)

Algorithm:

  1. Handle negative exponent by inverting x and negating n
  2. Use recursive binary exponentiation (fast power)
  3. If n is even: pow(x, n) = pow(x * x, n / 2)
  4. If n is odd: pow(x, n) = x * pow(x * x, (n - 1) / 2)

Time Complexity: O(log n) - halving exponent each step

Space Complexity: O(log n) - recursion stack

Key Insights:

  • Naive approach of multiplying x n times is O(n) â€” too slow for large n
  • Binary exponentiation reduces to O(log n) by squaring
  • Must handle negative exponents: x^(-n) = (1/x)^n
